args: After driving off the fiends who attacked the city,\nwe moved on to the next problem.
Up to this point, the town watch had been able to\nhandle fiends on their ownâ€”but the Progenitor's\nrevival changed everything.
The fiends that attacked the town were driven\nberserk by black mana, and the guards didn't\nstand a chance. As such, it is no longer safe here.
My father spoke with officials to arrange for the\ntownspeople's evacuation, but it was going to\ntake days and days to move them all to safety.
So we decided to stay here and protect the town\nuntil everyone was able to evacuate.
Is that the last of them?
Hello, Ignacio. Did you need something?
We've made arrangements to leave town,\nbut I wanted to thank you once more\nbefore we go.
Oh, but it is! Honestly, I wish there was\nsome way to thank you with more than\njust mere words.
Yes, I... Well, I haven't eaten anything\nsince early this morning.
Then I insist you join my family for supper!
It's no imposition at all. Besides, my Nico\nwould love to see you again.
I accepted Ignacio's offer and decided to\nhave dinner with his family.
The meal was simple and meager, but there was\njoy in the air all the same. It was a warm, friendly\noccasion where I felt the love of everyone present.
I can't thank you enough, Lady Sheila!
I really wish you would stop attempting\nto do so all the same.
Oh, he's been like this ever since he saw\nyou back in town. Honestly, the man is\nlike a child all over again!
Daddy's like a child! Hee hee!
All right, all right. But seriously, how can\nI NOT be excited when we have a real-life\nhero right here in our midsts?
Anyone would look up to her after what\nshe's doneâ€”so I'm going to take a page\nout of her book and conquer my fears!
Why do you want to change so badly?
When I see something that's changed,\nit makes me sad. But when I see a thing\nthat hasn't, it fills me with happiness.
I think you are fine the way you are.
I think I see what you're trying to say.
But change doesn't have to be a sad\noccasion. In fact, it can be joyous!
For instance, Nico went to fetch the\ningredients for today's dinner, which\nwas his first errand out of the house.
It seems like only yesterday he was barely\nable to totter around, but now he can run\nto the market! Oh, but they do grow fast...
Regardless, when I see how my child has\ngrown, the joy threatens to overwhelm me.\nSo like I said, change isn't always sad.
You may not be conscious of it yet, but in\nyour heart of hearts, I think you know that\nchange can be good.
Oh, I'm so sorry! It's not my place\nto lecture you like that!
(He's happy to see his son grow.\nBut as for me...)
You're back late, Sheila.\nDid something happen?
Oh, nothing really. ...But may I ask\nyou a question, Father?
I told him everything I'd been feeling in my heart.

Ignacio said he was happy to see his child change
day by day, yet change brought me nothing but
sadness. In truth, I wanted nothing more than to
lock the world in place as it was forever.
Was it wrong to wish for things to stay the same?\nAnd what would Father think about this?
...Hmm, I see. I knew you'd been fixated\non something since we arrived here,\nand now I know the cause.
Sheila, I'm just happy that you're here\nwith me like this.

But nothing can stay the same forever.
No matter how badly you wish it to not
be so, everything moves onâ€”including
you and me.
You will. You HAVE. Why, just now you\nopened up to me about your true feelings.\nYou would not have done that before, no?
This is proof you are not the person today\nthat you were yesterday.
You might feel like you've been left behind\nby all the things that have occurred during\nyour absence, but that's not quite right.
Until now, your changes were just delayed.\nBut now, you'll be evolving at the same\nrate as everyone else.
It may be just small things at first, but as\nyour father, I'm so proud to see even the\ntiniest bits of growth from you.
Do you still feel change to be a sad thing?
No. I can now see the joy in it.\nThank you, Father.
Now then, we have much left to do,\nso we should use today to rest andâ€”
Hmph. It seems nobody taught these\nfiends to knock! Haaah!
That was careless. I never thought their\nnext attack would come so quickly.
Rest will have to wait. We'll cut our way\nthrough this and get to the townspeople\nas quickly as possible. Are you ready?
